detailed_results.question: What is oreign Exchange Risk Mitigation?
detailed_results.ground_truth: Foreign Exchange Risk Mitigation is a strategy used by companies to minimize the risk of exchange rate fluctuations affecting their financial transactions.Some methods are like Invoicing in domestic currency: An exporter can invoice his foreign customer in his domestic currency or an importer can arrange with his foreign supplier to be invoiced in his domestic currency.
detailed_results.prediction:
Foreign Exchange Risk Mitigation is a method to reduce the risk of exchange rate fluctuations when dealing with international transactions.

Here are some key points about Foreign Exchange Risk Mitigation:

• It involves invoicing foreign customers in domestic currency.
• Importers can arrange with their foreign suppliers to be invoiced in domestic currency.
• Only one party (either the exporter or importer) can avoid exchange risk in this way.

detailed_results.question: What is VAT Assessment?
detailed_results.ground_truth: VAT Assessment is the process of determining the value of goods and services for Value Added Tax (VAT) purposes. Few VAT Assessment are aaluation : Determining the value of goods and services for VAT purposes. Preparation of value Declaration : Preparing the value declaration form for major industries, manufacturers, commercial traders, and service renderers. Use of Fair Market Price: Using the fair market price for value determination.
detailed_results.prediction:
VAT Assessment refers to the process of determining the value of goods and services subject to Value Added Tax (VAT). The key aspects of VAT Assessment include:

• Valuation: Determining the value of goods and services for VAT purposes.
• Preparation of value Declaration: Preparing a declaration for major industries, including the use of Fair Market Price (FMP) for value determination.
• Valuation for services: Determining the value of services subject to VAT.

detailed_results.question: Under rule 8(4), what auxiliary register must be maintained if a separate nursing or maternity home is maintained by a medical practitioner?
detailed_results.ground_truth: Under Rule 8(4), a medical practitioner who maintains a separate nursing or maternity home must maintain an auxiliary register showing the following particulars: Name and address of the patient, Nature of the treatment, Room (diet and/or lodging) charges. • Other fees charged from him, if any

detailed_results.question: Is online banking safe in Bangladesh?
detailed_results.ground_truth: Online banking in Bangladesh is not entirely safe due to the sone reasons: cheque related frauds are the most commonly experienced fraud incidences in Bangladesh and online banking may be vulnerable to similar types of fraud. Banks are identified as the most vulnerable sector of Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing (ML&TF) in Bangladesh which increases the risk of financial crimes.
detailed_results.prediction:
Online banking safety in Bangladesh is a concern. Here are some key points to consider:

• Mobile Banking systems can be abused to launder money, similar to bank accounts.
• A person can easily set up multiple accounts under their own or false names and transfer money between them to evade investigators.
• This misuse of mobile financial services is a criminal activity that can occur in Bangladesh.

While online banking may offer benefits such as increased literacy on digital financial services and convenience for providers, the risk of abuse cannot be ignored.

detailed_results.question: What is an example of how financing decisions can impact a firm's existence?

detailed_results.question: What is the opportunity cost?
detailed_results.ground_truth: The opportunity cost is the value of the next best alternative that is forgone when a decision is made. In this case, the opportunity cost is the value of the alternative use of Material X., The opportunity cost of Material X is the sales proceeds forgone if it is not used in the project., The opportunity cost is the value of the alternative use of Material X, which is:, Selling 500 kg of Material X for 3,000 CU, Purchasing 1,000 kg of Material X for 4,000 CU
detailed_results.prediction:
The opportunity cost is the value of the next best alternative forgone. In this case, it refers to the cash flow that would have been earned if a resource (in this case, a machine) was used differently.

Here are some key points about opportunity costs:

• The opportunity cost is the value of the next best alternative forgone.
• It is the cash flow that would have been earned if a resource was used differently.
• Opportunity costs reflect the cash forgone as a consequence of using resources.

detailed_results.question: How did Bangladeshs VAT system change after the 2012 VAT Act?
detailed_results.ground_truth: After the 2012 VAT Act, Bangladesh's VAT system sees significant changes. Like migration from 1991 VAT Act which is based account current to new system. The new system was designed to be more efficient and effective in managing account current balances. The VAT system now uses a prepaid vs postpaid system.
detailed_results.prediction:
The Bangladeshi VAT system underwent changes after the 2012 VAT Act. Key changes include:

• The standard VAT rate was reduced to 15%.
• Certain items are exempt from VAT.
• A truncated rate (short value addition) is applicable for many services, with a full rate of 15% for companies providing services under this system.
• Input rebate is applicable for companies providing services under the full rate of 15%.

These changes aim to simplify and streamline the VAT system in Bangladesh.
